2017 WW07 NFVi Gold Release Announcement (BKC #3)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW07 NFVi Gold release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n Ubuntu14.04.5\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Ren, Shu.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
Ubuntu14.04.5BKC-NFVi_Ubuntu14_19.112652-2017WW07.zip\n \n
\n 		BKC-NFVi_Ubuntu14_19.112652-2017WW07.zip\n \n
\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\n
\n\n
\n
\n   Summary \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

Key Updates

\xc2\xb7       \nSwitch 25GbE FVL to ES2\nstepping, please refer to the HW/SW ingredient table for detailed configuration

\xc2\xb7       \nMPS mismatch issue(5345808) has been fixed with BIOS D0412

\xc2\xb7       \nTotal test cases: 84; Attempted test cases:\n30 (Attempted rate: 100%); Passed test cases: 83 and pass rate is 98.81%.\nPlease visit HPQC for test details

Key Issues

    \xc2\xb7        5345895 - [NFVi _WFP][WW04][DPDK SR-IOV] tagged vlan filter function\nbehavior is abnormal SR-IOV device in testpmd

\n\n\n\n

    \n
  • Unexpected VLAN filter behavior with SR-IOV VF devices in testpmd RX
    • \n
  • This issue can be consistently reproduced on 4.4.6 driver. But no repro on later 5.0.4 and kernel driver 3.15.1-k
  • Narrowed down to ND Driver issue, involve driver team to understand the failure cause
    • \n

Release Note

\xc2\xb7       \nThe release is based on Ubuntu14.04.5 with kernel 3.13.0-100 generic, only contain the SW package,\nno auto-installer support

\xc2\xb7       \nInstallation step: 

\xc2\xa7  Install\nUbuntu14.04.5 Server

\xc2\xa7  Download\nthe SW package and unzip it, Copy the APP folder to /opt/ of target SUT

\xc2\xa7  Navigate\nto /opt/APP/script, run update_kernel.sh to update kernel to 3.13.0-100, reboot\nthe system 

\xc2\xa7  Navigate\nto /opt/APP/script, run setup.sh to install required libs and SW dependencies

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n

Note: All SW ingredients\nare released by source code, refer to README for\ninstallation details

InformationQuick Guide
BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website:  https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Click on "Add or Remove access"
  • Navigate to:"BKC \xe2\x80\x93 NFVi"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Ren, Shu

BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication
